awd_titl_txt: Surface/Interface Phenomena and Topological Order in Emerging Quantum Materials
awd_abstract_narration:
Non-Technical Abstract:
In recent years interest is increasing in a class of emerging new materials called topological insulators (TI) displaying unexpected quantum properties at their surfaces/interfaces. This has led to vast advancement in quantum science, and with potential for future quantum devices that can be energy efficient for information storage and transmission. These new materials can carry current without dissipation and are capable of enhancing the performance in existing technology such as spintronics (used in computer data storage, communication and sensing). Another topology related phenomenon is a new type of quantum state called Majorana bound states (MBS) that can appear in TIs by combining materials with different physical phenomena (topology, superconductivity, magnetism), which may lead to future highly fault-tolerant quantum computing. In this project, students as well as young scientists acquire knowledge and train in many advanced areas, as well as push the frontiers of physics and material science. There is potential to lay the foundation for establishing energy efficient quantum electronics to revolutionize the future information technology. Instruments, patents and knowledge developed during this research would be made available to companies.

Technical Abstract:
The demonstration of two-dimensional quantum coherent properties and unexpected stabilization of interfacial ferromagnetism to much higher temperatures in TI by proximity coupling to a ferromagnetic insulator, has prompted the investigation: i) to reach the occurrence of quantum coherent properties in a ferromagnetic TI at a higher temperatures, ii) the quantum behavior of spin polarized chiral current in TIs with proximity induced gap when hybridized with a magnetic insulator, and iii) probe unconventional superconducting pairing, the electron spin polarization and quantum coherence in the edge conduction channel of magnetic TI by tunneling spectroscopy. These goals are achievable based on our extensive previous related multidisciplinary knowledge with thin film heterostructure properties using state of the art molecular beam epitaxial system for film growth and measurement facilities, including atomic level characterization of interfaces utilizing the national facilities.  Education and training of students (including high school students summer programs) and young scientists in the areas dictated quantum coherent topology driven phenomena are planned under this program.

por.por_cntn:
The main objective was understanding the interface/surface behavior of topological insulators – a class of quantum materials. Investigate the interfacial exchange interaction to understand the quantum behavior of heterostructures involving magnetic insulators and superconductors and topological insulators. Create topological superconductors and explore Majorana zero modes to verify theoretical predictions.

Established the theoretically predicted Majorana pair formation in superconducting Au surface states. This is not only new physics but also has the potential as robust topological qubit for viable quantum computers development.

Showed the occurrence of induced triplet superconductivity in Ni–Ga bilayer interface

Demonstrated three state memory in ferrimagnetic insulating magnon valves

Exchange field induced absolute spin valve tunnel junctions including exchange field driven Josephson junctions

Universal superconducting nonreciprocity in critical current (superconducting diode phenomena) observed

Produced quantum workforce (postdocs, students at all levels)– 7 postdocs, 3 undergrads, 2 MIT graduate students during summer, 2 visiting grad students from Europe (for 6 months) and 17 high-school students (~35% females) participated in the PI’s research and achieved distinction in science competitions.

Initiated new international collaborations

Obtained a US patent on topological qubit based on the Majorana pair observation in superconducting gold surface – a new scalable and robust platform   

Relevant educational videos developed (links below), nearly 40 or more international seminars given. Promo Video (https://youtu.be/CarjtNi5mzs); Demo video (https://youtu.be/WiyF46iLYi8)

Postdoctorals trained in all aspects for a successful career: have entered academic career as well as industrial R&D setting

International exposure in the respective fields, professional contacts developed, and conference presentations

Based on the group’s results and vision on the Majorana physics from the previous NSF period, scientific demonstration contents aimed at promoting US quantum literacy have been prepared and made available to the general public.
